content.description: The crux is towards the middle of the climb, the nerves really start getting to you and there are less good hand holds. Most of the climb will be jugs or crimps but sometimes an occasional sloper. Feet are very good on this climb, for reference I was able to do this in running shoes. Be VERY careful when moving up the rock, a lot of the hand holds broke off when I was climbing, so double check every hold before lifting your weight on them. Once you top the boulder, you’ll be able to see the entire trail.
content.location: The trail leads to an overhanging section of the boulder. You’ll have to go to the right side and behind some brush, then you can proceed to go straight up the slab from the ground.

content.description: The boulder is on the trail to the right, you won’t miss it as it’s the tallest rock in the area. It’s super chossy and and some of the rock is brittle. Be very cautious when putting weight onto small flakes.
